title: Calories in a Three Egg Omelette
meta_description: Discover calories in three egg omelette, including protein, fat, carbs, full nutrition breakdown, and preparation tweaks for better tracking.
h1: Calories in a Three Egg Omelette
assumptions: Plain omelette using large eggs, cooked in 1 tsp butter or oil total, no added salt, fillings, or cheese.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by egg size, cooking fat amount, brand, and additions like veggies or cheese. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A plain three-egg omelette provides ~270 kcal and ~18 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Add veggies like spinach and tomatoes (1/2 cup total)

faqs.q: How many calories in one egg omelette?
faqs.a: About 90 kcal for a plain one-egg omelette.

faqs.q: What is the protein in a three egg omelette?
Does cooking method affect calories in three egg omelette?
faqs.a: Yes, more oil or butter increases fat and calories; non-stick pan with minimal fat keeps it lower.

faqs.q: Are carbs high in a plain three egg omelette?
faqs.a: No, only ~1.8 g carbs total, mostly from the eggs.

faqs.q: How does adding fillings change calories in three egg omelette?
faqs.a: Fillings like cheese or ham can add 50-200 kcal; veggies add fewer.
